cyclone.name: PHILIPPE
cyclone.current_location: about 415 mi SSW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to accelerate northward overnight, cross western Cuba late Saturday, then turn northeast through the north-western Bahamas and off the southeast Florida coast on Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Cuba near Isla de la Juventud / southern coast of Cuba

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas (Cat Island, Exumas, Long Island, Rum Cay, San Salvador)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Western Cuba (Isla de la Juventud, La Habana, Ciudad de la Habana, Matanzas, Cienfuegos, Villa Clara) and the Northwestern Bahamas (Abacos, Andros Island, Berry Islands, Bimini, Eleuthera, Grand Bahama Island, New Providence)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba, Florida Keys and South Florida, Northwestern and Central Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤8%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; brief gusts 30–40 mph possible Sunday as the center passes east of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; no surge watches/warnings in effect for southeast Florida.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 8 inches possible Saturday night–Sunday, producing localized flash flooding in urban areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls could create short-notice operational delays and reduced visibility.
